instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dead
threads.message:
This <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in dead by a small amount of water

Bad corrosion on <CHIP>U8005</CHIP>. Pulled and replaced <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> with new one and wired pin1 to <CAPACITOR>C8005</CAPACITOR>/p1 as this trace was burned. Also replaced <CAPACITOR>C8005</CAPACITOR>.

Now there is no fan spin, and all pins (<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PCH_HSIO_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SW_PCH_HSIO</SIGNAL>) on <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> are low (a couple of mV)

But if I pull <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> off the board only <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0SW_PCH_HSIO</SIGNAL> is low... The other ones <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> = 5V, <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> = 1.05V, <SIGNAL>PCH_HSIO_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.3V and the fan starts spinning.

Board does not boot obviously without this chip.

Diode mode <CHIP>U8005</CHIP>:

on the board:

p1: 0.43
p2: 0.10
p3: 0.10
p5: 0.18
p7: 0.18
p8: 0.00
p9: 0.46

off the board:

p1: 0.43
p2: 0.09
p3: 0.09
p5: 0.17
p7: 0.17
p8: 0.00
p9: 0.46

What's going on ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Dead
threads.message:
I bet when <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> is on the board it successfully powers on but is power cycling. When <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> is off it just hangs half way in the power up sequence.

Inspect the usual areas around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>/traces/termination resistors, clock chip, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, etc.
